Reviews.Title: Amazing Photo quality
Reviews.Author: Joebar
Reviews.Content: This small camera is really good. Photo quality are excellent.from ISO 100 to ISO 3200.The guide mode is very good to set the camera to a particular situation.The camera feels very solid. The autofocus 11 points is fast with the ViewFinderYou feels like a pro.The results are superior than the D5000 or D90 at 1600ISO and 3200 ISOThe video mode is light. It is not a camcorder. But the video is good.The sound is mono but I knew that. I didn't buy it for the video mode.I already have a CANON HFS21 which is better than any DSLR.The price is reasonable. you can buy the D3100 , 18-55, 55-300mm , 35mmf1.8, SB700 forthe same price than a D7000 ( which is not superior to the D3100 up to 1600 ISO. it is maybea bit better at 3200 and better at 6400 but not that far).I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Computer Nut
Reviews.Content: I received this Camera for Christmas, it was purchased from, adorama camera through Amazon, and it came with a starter case and DVD as wellThis is an awesome camera for an entry level DSLR, in my mind Nikon's the bestI've had it for over a whole month now and I've taken over 2000 pictures already, I love this camera, the only thing is that the 55-200 lens that came with my camera doesn't have VR.This is a great camera for someone just getting in to DSLR photography, as well as someone who has used manual 35mm film SLRsIt's a big step up from a digital point and shoot for sure, I took close to 500 pictures Christmas night without using the flash, and only 2 or 3 pictures were slightly burry, only because the subject that was being photographed moved.I went on a short trip shooting pictures with a friend and he said it seemed like we went on different trips because of the difference in our picturesUpdate: The view finder on this camera is not sealed, allowing dust, and material from the camera bag to get inside the view finder, and it is not covered under the warranty!

Reviews.Title: beginning shutterbug opinion
Reviews.Author: grmaitro
Reviews.Content: A full-featured camera, with plenty of things to learn- as a starting shutterbug, i have not found anything that I feel is lacking or substandard in this product.  One thing that I have found that I am not clear as to the why is the limitation of 10 minutes or 2 gigs for video, but for this camera, video is a bonus feature, NOT a primary focus.  If you want to have a long-recording video camera, then it really should be a video camera, not a DSLR.

Reviews.Title: D3100 - An excellent DSLR for beginners
Reviews.Author: Xen
Reviews.Content: I was searching for my first DSLR this Spring and after a lot of investigation chose Nikon D3100. Before I made my purchase I had came down to 3 choices from all cameras I looked for - Canon T1i/T2i and Nikon D3100. And I chose D3100 for its great and competitive features and equally important its better pricing as compared to Canon counterparts.I brought Canon T1i first from local retail shop and used it for a week and I also took D3100 and compared both in home. I took different snaps with both Canon T1i and Nikon D3100. After comparing multiple indoor and outdoor pictures, I came to my conclusion that - T1i was slightly better than D3100 indoor but D3100 was way better than D3100 in outside snaps. Another factor was price which was very important when you chose on DSLRs because you should get the best value for your money. I found D3100 pricing better than Canon T1i looking at all similar features they are offering. Then I decided that I am going to keep my D3100 and return Canon T1i. Again Canon T1i/T2i are great cameras but for me looking at all necessary DSLR features I needed and pricing, I felt D3100 is best choice. It offers all important features that Canon T1i/T2i offers and some very new that are exclusive to D3100. And D3100 is cheaper than T1i/T2i so it is best value for money.I am using D3100 a lot now and I have to say I made the correct choice. It captures awesome snaps. Its auto focus is OK- not perfect but not bad. It has great HD video feature but I dont shoot video a lot so I dont care on it. As far as picture quality and editing features, D3100 rocks as my first DSLR. I took extra 55-200 mm VR lens along with regular kit lens and all set is working great for me. Do get a good camera bag for your kit. I am enjoying in my photography world !

Reviews.Title: JUST BUY THIS CAMERA!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Ravi Patel
Reviews.Content: OK so i'm a high school student who was interested in photography ever since i took my first photography class. I loved all the things relating or about photography. I always used to use some point and shoot camera but not anymore. I BOUGHT THIS CAMERA and couldn't be more happier. This is a superb DSLR for the money. It has FANTASTIC & CRISP IMAGES. I  can't afford a 1,000+ DSLR so i bought this one. This still is a great DSLR. I currently own the kit lens but they still gives some of the best quality photos i ever took. i posted some of my sample images. One thing that I don't like about this DSLR is the 10 minute limit in movie recording but oh well. after all it is a DSLRR and not a camcorder. I plan to get more lenses and may post some test pics later on. Bottom line, BUY THIS DSLR, and never a canon.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Jean M. Hampton "ibahduba"
Reviews.Content: I thought I wanted a little camera I could take in my pocket....so I got a Kodak 580, 14 megapixel ....It was horrible.  1 out of 10 pics were acceptable.  I lost so many great chances with my kids and grandbabies.  The Nikon D3100 definitely will not fit in my pocket, but it is so easy to use!  I have not had a bad pic and we have shot over 800 since mid-December.  I am excited about really learning this camera.  So far, all I have used is the auto mode.  If it does this well in auto , I can only imagine what I will get when I actually know what I am doing.  This is a great entry level SLR, well worth the money.  You don't get to buy back the memories you loose with an inferior camera.

Reviews.Title: Product not as titled
Reviews.Author: Karim Yassin
Reviews.Content: D3100 is a great camera, but the kit arrived was not as mentioned on product page, The 55-200mm I got was a NON-VR lens... it really made me feel bad about it. But the camera is lovely

Reviews.Title: The best camera I can ever own
Reviews.Author: amashopper
Reviews.Content: I'm a beginner and since I was taking a photography technique class I figure I should get a DSLR in order to learn all that I need to learn...This camera is so easy to use and going through the function is not a problem at all. Coming from a point-and-shoot to an this SLR was not a problem at all.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA AND PICTURES
Reviews.Author: Glenn J. Donofri
Reviews.Content: Overall better quality pictures than my Nikon P80. Easy to use and the battery seems to last a good while.

Reviews.Title: Complete satisfaction
Reviews.Author: chasroc56
Reviews.Content: I can only say this about my Nikon 3100, that for the price of this camera and what it does, I am completely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: I haven't gotten much of a chance to REALLY play around with and master this camera, but I'm in love with it. The quality of the photos is far superior to my previous Kodak point & shoot camera. Easy to work, even though the directions on how to do certain things are a little confusing. I highly recommend this camera, and the lens it comes with.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Kuntz "Lost in Time"
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent SLR camera. It is very versatile and takes consistently excellent pictures. It came with the 18-55mm lens and I also opted to purchase the 55-200mm lens. They are quickly and easily interchangeable. I would recommend this camera to anyone looking to upgrade from a point and shoot model.

Reviews.Title: First Nikon
Reviews.Author: JDH24458
Reviews.Content: The Nikon D3100 is my first DSLR. I've had it slightly over six months, sufficient time to evaluate it. The camera does everything that Nikon says it does and has operated flawlessly. The lenses are lighter and feel like there is some 'play' in the focusing compared to old SLR versions. I haven't found much utility in the VR function, but the autofocusing gives generally excellent results. The learning curve for operating the D3100 is a much bigger digital version of the old SLR. The best part of acquiring the D3100 is that my interest in imaging has been rekindled in a really big way. The Amazon purchase process was fast and easy to accomplish. The pricing was, of course, highly competitive so the value in taking the Amazon route was high.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D3100
Reviews.Author: Plein Page "art junkie"
Reviews.Content: Camera and lenses arrived in great shape. Camera was well-packed. What can I say? it's a Nikon; easy to use, explore, understand.

Reviews.Title: nikon d3100
Reviews.Author: jbtodd
Reviews.Content: Great camera, quality of pictures is awsome. Takes studio quality pictures that that will make you forget about your little point and shoot camera. Your point and shoot is small enough to carry around about anywhere to catch quick snap shots, but for planned events, get togethers, holidays, or anyting like that you will always be grabbing for your nikon d3100. It is as easy to use in auto mode as my pocket camera, but also has a lot of other functions and plenty of atatchments. Bottom line is  it's a great camera, gives crisp and clear picture,and has great accesories to acomodate whatever type of photography you want to do. I love it.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: pilar yepes "Pily"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera last year, ITs wonderfull, my daugther love to take pictures with it, ITs a very good camera easy to use and change lenses.

Reviews.Title: Semi Pro
Reviews.Author: Marc Stump
Reviews.Content: I have a photography business and I have used Nikon for years.The camera is basically my back up for a higher grade of Nikon. I often find for events and non portraits jobs. I call them walk around jobs. This unit is used more than the bigger far more expensive camera.I find the photos are great and the camera has on board editing if you choose to off load them straight from the camera for use.I plan on upgrading to the 5200 or next level up but my 3100 has easily taken 20,000 images without a lick of problems or issues.I would recommend it. it also shoots pretty descent video. You need to have extra battery's for the video it uses them up pretty fast. But I believe that's a standard thing with this level of camera.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Raymond
Reviews.Content: Fantastic camera, takes great pictures!Looked at Photography reviews, hard to beat this camera for the money!Above my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Elijah M.
Reviews.Content: pros:I adore this camera! the moment i got it i began playing with it and figuring it out. going from a point and shoot to an DSLR meant it took a little geting used to but after a few hours everything made sense. the interface is easy to understand and follow and the multipoint focus is a godsend. both lenses work flawlessly and the image quality is fantastic.cons: it wont totally let you adjust the shutter speed which is quite a small thing. also when using the larger lens the shutter sound is magnified which will scare off animals and freak out pets the first time they hear it.verdict: amazing camera, quality is fantastic for the money you pay. i use this camera on a daily basis and i couldn't be happier. it was all that i expected and more. id definitely recommend this to anyone who is trying to get into DSLRs bud dont want to compromise on quality

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: dj
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted a nice camera such as this nikon. I did the research and talked to other people with dslr cameras all whom recommended nikon and wished they would have gotten nikon....it didn't take to long for  me to figure out some of the simple modes of the camera, it is a great starter package if you are a beginner...the only downside is I see more lenses in my future....a must get....

Reviews.Title: CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: THE NIKON 3100 14 MP DIGITAL CAMERA WITH THE EXTRA LENS IS A GOOD STARTER SETUP FOR A GUY LIKE ME.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D3100
Reviews.Author: NSchumacher
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this camera. Right out of the box this pretty much newbie was able to get some perfect pics while I slowly learn the finer points of photography.

Reviews.Title: Great starter DSLR
Reviews.Author: Paul P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I love this camera. We've used cybershot for years and decided to splurge on a new beginning. Camera is great and takes high quality pics. We are now the family studio....yeh.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D3100 14.2MP Digital SLR Camera
Reviews.Author: Skiter
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. This one was a Christmas present, I own the same exact model myself. Takes great pictures!

Reviews.Title: Great for begginers
Reviews.Author: Crystal Summers
Reviews.Content: I think this is the ideal type of camera for a beginner into the world of DSLR. It's not as good as the D3200 or the D800 but it does the job.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Starter Camera
Reviews.Author: T. Khetia
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my father-in-law, and when I received it, I figured I should use and it compare it with my SLR. This was during the fall of 2011, when the trees in the North East were bright Red and colorful. I took the same shot with my starter lens vs the Nikon's, and both on Auto settings, and the Nikon picture was more crisp, with great color range, and better overall finish. I wish I bought one of these for me as well, but then I was beginning to unlock the potential of my SLR and knew that I would keep mine as I'd discover more options in it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Reader101
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures, is easy to use and was a great price!  I still have much to learn about using the advanced settings, but you can pick it up, use the guide and take great pictures out of the box!

Reviews.Title: this is my first shutter but
Reviews.Author: Heavy Hitter
Reviews.Content: this is a great starter camera and could not be happier. I have taken some great pictures with it and now I am ready to add a few more lenses to take even better shots.extremely happy with this camera...

Reviews.Title: good, but... wishing I could splurged on a full frame
Reviews.Author: Amy "Amy"
Reviews.Content: I like this. But I really wanted a full frame.The reason it gets 4 stars is because you cannot use a wireless remote shutter with this model but you could with the d3000. I dont get that. I ordered one and had to return it.

Reviews.Title: Incredible pictures
Reviews.Author: Jeffery Anderson
Reviews.Content: I have 2 girls who play lots of sports.  This camera takes the most amazing shots of movement I have seen.  This is my first dslr.  I couldn't be happier with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with my new camera
Reviews.Author: J. Vulcan
Reviews.Content: So far I've only been able to play with my new camera a few times, but so far I am very happy.The camera and kit lenses arrived as advertised, with all of the features that are so highly rated for this items, such as the helpful Guide mode on the camera and the vibration reduction feature on the lenses.  The features and controls are a little different than the other Nikon I'm used to, and that's taking some getting used to.  The photos are great.

Reviews.Title: NIkon D3100
Reviews.Author: kamilahelaine "kamilahelaine"
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with my new Nikon D3100. It came exactly as advertised, and although I am a novice photographer, I enjoy learning new things daily.I feel that this camera is very user-friendly and is the perfect entry-level DSLR. My pictures have improved so much already!

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: fsnoles1984
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing! Right out of the box in auto mode, it takes great photos. I'm still in the process of learning the camera and all it's features. There is so much unlocked potential!

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: Koukla
Reviews.Content: I am a beginner photographer, bought this camera on a suggestion from my photographer friend. I love it! Easy to use, comfortable grip, great photos!

Reviews.Title: It would be a perfect camera if....
Reviews.Author: Troothe & Str8 AnSirs "Str8 AnSirs"
Reviews.Content: The only thing that this camera is missing is bracketing.  Something so fundamental as bracketing has been left out. I would of gave it 4 stars if it had -2/+2 EV IN 1/13 EV steps and 5 stars if it had -5/+5 EV.  With the poor audio capture quality, Nikon should have traded 1080HD for bracketing and the price would have been less.  Save your money for the D7000 or go to the D5000 and sacrifice for 720HD and lower resolution, pixels and ISO options.  just sayin'

Reviews.Title: Uma ótima câmera por um bom preço.
Reviews.Author: Andre Porto
Reviews.Content: A nikon 3100 e' uma ótima câmera e creio que seja o melhor custo-beneficio para quem quer ir um pouco alem do básico. Claro que não tem todos os recursos das câmeras profissionais, mas chega perto, muito perto disso.

Reviews.Title: Not So Great. Canon Blows it Away
Reviews.Author: Joseph Nocella
Reviews.Content: I had this camera for a few days and had to return it. I had problems with auto-focus. The video was choppy and noisy. I then tried a Canon T2i and there is no comparison. As soon as I opened the Canon box and saw all of the necessary cables , I felt better. Plus the manual and software are so much better and easier to understand. The pictures are much better in my opinion too. The video is better. The sound is better. It feels better in your hands. Even the neck strap is better. Everything is just better. Yes it costs a little more but it is definitely worth it. I like having bracketing and the extra mic input. I also like not having to pay extra for cables for TV and PC which Nikon should include but I guess they need to squeeze every dollar out of their customers. Maybe it's not fair to compare these two because the Canon cost a little more, but that's the point. In this case it is worth it to spend the extra money. For the extra money, I am MUCH happier and you will be too.

Reviews.Title: Unhappy
Reviews.Author: Walter J. Dudek Jr. "Poppop"
Reviews.Content: Never got to use the camera. Received defective 55-200mm zoom lens. Sent back and received a second defective zoom lens from Cameta Camera.

Reviews.Title: Dissapointed
Reviews.Author: Nico
Reviews.Content: The camera itself is great.But the product didn't come with the 55-200 lense. They only offered me a refund, discount or complete return. I know they don't have a replacement for the lense alone, but considering they made a mistake, they should have offered me the missing lense alone. Ended up buying the lense myself.
